content: I hear the dates will be announced soon!

Here we go
-5384425887556034670_121.jpg
Really Oliver? LOL Thank you for sharing on my behalf;)
Dang I forgot you folks are on here now, too!
Sorry! :pray:
Exciting!
I hope we get to play the Dataverse Cup in that stadium! :soccer: :trophy:
@Philip Durbin We can ask about the stadium but the Dataverse Cup will likely happen on Dorrance Field https://maps.app.goo.gl/YHgrEkEBnwLjxe57A
Well I wish y'all a pleasant cup! The chances I'll be at UNC are slim at best, trending towards 0. :disappointed:
Noooo... Should we pass the hat?!? There should be a way for core contributors to be able to attend if their employers can't or won't fund them.

Ha, @Dwayne Liburd just let me know we tweeted about #Dataverse2025 two months ago: https://x.com/dataverseorg/status/1831007080439792074

I guess I don't pay much attention to Twitter these days. :sweat_smile:
And here's the website mentioned in that tweet: https://dcm2025.hsites.harvard.edu

A lovely "save the date" announcement by @Don Sizemore here: https://groups.google.com/g/dataverse-community/c/a-NCKQu4agA/m/chZmv0zrAwAJ

Thanks! June 9-12, 2025. See you there!
To make this the best Dataverse Community Meeting ever, please fill out the survey @Don Sizemore just posted at https://groups.google.com/g/dataverse-community/c/kzrfgtTHge8/m/BwHmVZ-tAgAJ !
@Don Sizemore I clicked the survey link in the Google Doc and in an email I got, but got the message "You have either already completed the survey or your session has expired."

Sherry Lake said:
I don't get that screen in Chrome or Firefox, but admittedly I haven't taken the survey myself. Have you tried different browsers and/or private/incognito?

@Don Sizemore ~~ works in Chrome - icognito.
Didn't in Chrome "regular". ~~

Ah.....

I know why... I got the survey link before Thanksgiving filled it out and promptly forgot.
So the message was correct - I had already completed it.

It was sent to Dataverse Repo managers, I assume those who were either GDCC members or email in the list of Installations.
you're part of the inner circle, Sherry :heart:
Hello! Will the 2025 community meeting be hybrid? I ask because myself and a colleague are hoping to submit a presentation, but we may not be able to attend the meeting in person
@Lubov McKone Hello! I just asked in our staff meeting: we will support hybrid attendance, but presenters will need to attend in person.
@Don Sizemore Got it, thanks!
Looking forward to try some line dancing! https://tcdancers.org (Seems like every second Friday they are on, which would line up nicely)

The theme of the Dataverse 2025 Community Meeting is "Expanding the Dataverse: Advancing Innovation, Building Community, Establishing Legacy."

We welcome abstract submissions of papers, presentations, panel discussion topics, posters, and workshop sessions via
https://www.cvent.com/c/abstracts/f70b9094-7988-4b3e-910a-69b0ab11e78c

Please find the full announcement here:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QUJ25RREmmI19LcarRcPpvFE3HZmjGyt/view?usp=sharing

For questions related to submissions, please contact the organizing committee at dcm-2025@unc.edu

I don't know when the DCM2025 conference site will go live, but I have 4 hotel courtesy blocks and wanted to provide them. It's looking like June 9th will offer workshops, the conference begins in earnest on the 10th and is extended to the morning of the 13th.

1) Carolina Inn (Hyatt) +19199332001

   doesn't do courtesy blocks.

2) AC (Marriott) on Rosemary +19199692800 (Don's pick for price and location)

   $184 + $24.84 tax
   https://www.marriott.com/event-reservations/reservation-link.mi?id=1737139117175&key=GRP&guestreslink2=true&app=resvlink
   last day to book: May 10th

3) Graduate (Hilton) +19194429000

   $199/night + tax
   https://www.hilton.com/en/book/reservation/rooms/?ctyhocn=RDUGCGU&arrivalDate=2025-06-09&departureDate=2025-06-13&groupCode=90B&room1NumAdults=1

4) Hampton Inn Carrboro +19199696988

   doesn't do courtesy blocks, but a great location in Carrboro.

5) Aloft (Marriott) +19199327772

   $130/night, last day to book: 16 may 2025
   https://www.marriott.com/event-reservations/reservation-link.mi?id=1733425319456&key=GRP&guestreslink2=true&app=resvlink

6) Hyatt Southern Village +19199299511

   $119/night Single King or $129/night for a 2-Queen room.
   not too far from campus, next to the wonderful Weaver Street Market.
   https://www.hyatt.com/hyatt-place/en-US/rduzc-hyatt-place-chapel-hill-southern-village?corp_id=G-DATA
@Don Sizemore Which one is closer to the meeting? Any within walking distance?

@Sherry Lake The conference will be held next to Kenan Stadium in the Alumni Center ( https://maps.app.goo.gl/cLHVDhkDL9BfHc2r5 ). The Carolina Inn is easily the closest and nicest, but also the most expensive. AC is two blocks from campus, one mile from the conference and much cheaper. The Graduate is maybe two blocks farther west and not much more than the AC but I'm not a fan of West Cameron / West Franklin at night. The rest could be a short bike, bus or Über from the conference. I encourage early reservations to secure the best price.
@Sherry Lake note that Boshamer baseball stadium is immediately south-east of the alumni center, but the team will be away for summer ball.

But the Durham Bulls are home!!!
Road trip.... https://www.milb.com/durham/schedule/2025-06
:baseball:

Sherry Lake said:

But the Durham Bulls are home!!!
Road trip.... https://www.milb.com/durham/schedule/2025-06
:baseball:
Today I learned UNC has a famous tree, Davie Poplar.
there are three. sadly in 1996/7 some yahoo stripped all the bark off of #3 so technically it is #4.

And some yahoo detonated a device, according to Wikipedia:

"A fire was set and a small device was detonated at the base of Davie Poplar on November 2, 2017, producing a small fire ball and scorching the side of the tree.[3] The explosion caused minor injuries to Dr. Daniel Reichart who tried to stomp out the fire.[4]"

Hey Folks,
Just wanted to ensure folks were submitting abstracts for the Community Meeting! The deadline is 2/21/25, but we have asked for an extension and waiting to hear back from @Don Sizemore UNC -

https://www.cvent.com/c/abstracts/f70b9094-7988-4b3e-910a-69b0ab11e78c/submissions/create/submissionPage%3A1bb0c537-0538-4a56-9c03-da05b8d73deb

Hey Folks,
Just a reminder to submit abstracts for the community meeting! The deadline is 2/21/25

https://www.cvent.com/c/abstracts/f70b9094-7988-4b3e-910a-69b0ab11e78c/submissions/create/submissionPage%3A1bb0c537-0538-4a56-9c03-da05b8d73deb
@Sonia Barbosa The submission deadline has now been extended through March 15, 2025!
Could someone clarify -- this site https://dcm2025.hsites.harvard.edu/ says the dates are June 9th - 13 at the top , but other documents are saying the 10-13th. Which is correct? Thanks!

Bethany Seeger said:

Could someone clarify -- this site https://dcm2025.hsites.harvard.edu/ says the dates are June 9th - 13 at the top , but other documents are saying the 10-13th. Which is correct? Thanks!

@Don Sizemore I believe the dates were modified to incorporate workshops?

Luckily flying in on the Saturday, so will be able to make the workshops! Love me a workshop. Also, not sure if it's that important, but I don't think I got an email confirmation for my submission-- it does show up in the interface though, don't think it went so spam either!

Vaida Plankytė said:

Luckily flying in on the Saturday, so will be able to make the workshops! Love me a workshop. Also, not sure if it's that important, but I don't think I got an email confirmation for my submission-- it does show up in the interface though, don't think it went so spam either!

I will check with the planning folks on a confirmation email---not sure what they set up for this and I also didn't get a confirmation with mine so I am able to confirm your post;)
If you missed the update, the deadline for submission was extended until March 15th. Please share with your colleagues. Thanks
The website dates appear to be synced! June 9-13th ---
@Bethany Seeger the 9th was a hold-over from the earlier schedule (we had to shift a day). https://dcm2025.hsites.harvard.edu/ now reflects the 10th-13th which I understand to be correct.

Don Sizemore said:

Bethany Seeger the 9th was a hold-over from the earlier schedule (we had to shift a day). https://dcm2025.hsites.harvard.edu/ now reflects the 10th-13th which I understand to be correct.

10th (workshops) through the 13th (hackathon), with the 11th and 12th the main conference days.
@Vaida Plankytė Heath confirms that your submission is in, and that the web application is _configured_ to send e-mail confirmation. We may have to run this by Cvent's support, though.
@Vaida Plankytė there was a misconfiguration within Cvent. Once fixed, my test submission confirmation e-mail arrived immediately. Thank you for reporting this!
sure thing, glad it was helpful! and thanks for confirming the submission went through :sunglasses:

Don Sizemore said:

Lubov McKone Hello! I just asked in our staff meeting: we will support hybrid attendance, but presenters will need to attend in person.

Is it final decision, Don? I'm not going this year as I'm Ukrainian and that says it all.
I'm curious too - saw that the CFP was extended, but my colleague and I still can't attend in person.

@Slava Tykhonov @Lubov McKone the in-person requirement for presenters is not set in stone, given the number who are reticent to travel to the United States right now. our event folks are looking in to it.
Thanks, Don! I'm pretty sure that folks outside of the US also have something interesting to present. :)
Definitely. Always. :big_smile:
If you're traveling to the US do you plan to get a temporary SIM card for your phone? Asking for a friend. :big_smile:
I recall Dutch SIM cards aren't working in the US, assume European also. But probably there is also special roaming subscription required.
Verizon offers "TravelPass" which costs more but "just happens" when I travel. I'm billed a flat rate per day when I use a tower outside of the U.S.
I usually go for one of those SIM services that's marketed for digital nomads, something like https://maya.net/ as you can set it up before going!
Dear Community, I'm throwing together a list of "staff picks" for the Chapel Hill area: restaurants, bars, trails/arboretums, music venues, sporting events. What else interests you?
Hmm, coffee shops? Cool, indie bookstores?
I've included my personal favorite coffeeshop in the "Nature Lovers" section https://caffedriade.com/gallery/
and now that you mention bookstores I'll include https://www.epiloguebookcafe.com/
How's parking around the venue? I'm thinking of staying with a friend and renting a car.

@Courtney Mumma We're trying to secure some reserved spaces for attendees in the Ram's Deck next to the Alumni Center ( https://maps.app.goo.gl/K62XdnMzqJEWb82bA ) but if your friend lives on or near a bus line you're likely better off taking the bus (Chapel Hill Transit doesn't charge fares).

@Courtney Mumma worst case there are a number of paid decks/lots downtown (about a mile away) with a maximum daily fee, but historically Chapel Hill has intentionally not dealt with traffic / parking problems to encourage public transit.
oh that's so awesome that the bus network is free! :oncoming_bus:

@Vaida Plankytė 20 years ago the town sat down with a calculator and estimated the cost of building parking garages and widening roads against the cost of running buses. We have a good local bus system though the situation isn't perfect for commuters who can't afford Chapel Hill proper. Anyone attending the conference should be able to get most places, within reason, by bus or a short Über ride.
I submitted a talk!
Anyone know what the cost of the conference will be? Trying to submit my request to attend and need that detail. :smile:
I’ve heard an estimate; let me find out how close to “set in stone” it is.
@Deirdre Kirmis Heath says I can share these: $450 in person ($25 for reception/open bar, $75 for social dinner); $275 virtual; I think it's $50 discount for GDCC members
and, now that the announcement is live: https://goheels.com/news/2025/3/4/general-mexican-and-turkish-mens-soccer-national-teams-to-meet-june-10-at-kenan-stadium
So the Dataverse Cup will be the pre-game? :big_smile:
In previous years it was British footy? We're still having a Dataverse Cup, likely on Anson Dorrance Field rather than Kenan Stadium.
When my kid was small her basketball team was the halftime show at the "big kid" basketball game.
Let's watch these little kids play for a while. That was the idea.
At the Durham Bulls we get Wool E. Bull driving laps in a go-cart, with the opposing team attempting to dump their icy Gatorade coolers on him as he whizzes by.

faf05ab8-2909-4b65-938c-7584d155eaaa.jpg

Listening to Chatham Rabbits from North Carolina at Club Passim in Harvard Square
they're apparently owners of Sarah's family property, and the oldest continually-standing home in neighboring Guilford County, dating back to 1753.
tix are up for Mexico vs. Türkiye https://goheels.evenue.net/events/MXT
A message was moved from this topic to #community > WebXR Visualization Survey by Don Sizemore.

Don't forget to submit your abstract for the Dataverse Community Meeting, 2025!

https://www.cvent.com/c/abstracts/f70b9094-7988-4b3e-910a-69b0ab11e78c

If you've already decided on your travel plans and would like to share them with the community, you are welcome to add yourself to this DCM2025 in-person participants spreadsheet @Don Sizemore @Oliver Bertuch and I came up with.
I just expressed my interest to go line dancing on Friday 6/13. Break a leg... :see_no_evil:

Hey Folks, I'd like to point out that we hope to convene working group meetings during DCM2025. Like we did in 2024. This is an excellent opportunity to invite new community members to join. Please spread the word and include the working groups from the GDCC page so people know what they can join. @Philip Durbin ☀️
My brother on Chapel Hill: "I just remember it had a cool vibe and there was good food"
A little bird told me a lot of talks have been submitted! :bird:
I just got a notification that I need to decide which one of my two talk submission I want as a talk...
Yeah, me too :sweat_smile:
on Friday afternoon there were 26 submissions. on Monday morning there were 56. the committee is trying to fit (most) everything into the schedule.
For how many slots? (Assuming that's 56 talk submissions)
that's part of the question.

I'd be happy to move one or even both of them to a panel discussion if there are enough other talks that would make up a nice panel. Not sure how good that would actually work for my topics (software publications and migration/update/K8s). Maybe not controversial enough :sweat_smile:
@Oliver Bertuch each discussion response would begin with Harvard Business Review's recommended: "yes, and..." :big_smile:

Hey @Don Sizemore
From a previous zulip comment above.....

Can you confirm.... deny....
that these two costs are "in addition" to the $450: $25 for reception/open bar, $75 for social dinner

And.... does the $450 cover other meals (maybe lunch)?

UVa is sending a "team this year!!!!!! So I am in charge of getting costs and justifying budgets.
Thanks! I am excited!!!

@Sherry Lake Heath replies: covers breakfast lunch and coffee break/afternoon snack break
dinner and reception are in addition. open bar (those add-on prices include the open bar, almost certainly but not 100% confirmed because we haven't signed the catering contract yet)
it even includes a box lunch to take with them on the last day of the conference, which ends at noon

One more thing @Don Sizemore ..... the last day is the Hack-a-thon, right?

One (or two) of UVA folks might not stay for Friday, if that's the case. Tim, our SysAdmin is only coming "conference" days.... I assume that's Wed & Thursday?

I'm herding cats around here!! :smirk_cat:
I thought Tim was the cat. :thinking:

Philip Durbin ☀️ said:

I thought Tim was the cat. :thinking:

Tim, the cat, is very talented..... But Tim (the Stevens) is better at System Administration.
Could someone tell me the street address of the DCM25 venue? Thanks!
106 Stadium Dr, Chapel Hill NC https://maps.app.goo.gl/RviZhYWubrBGDFMc6
@Philipp Conzett hotel conference blocks are posted farther up in this thread, and I'm happy to answer any questions.
@Sherry Lake Friday was originally to be a hackathon, before the conference got shifted due to the MexTour game. I think Friday may be "conference time" now but the schedule isn't finalized.
@Sherry Lake Heath says Friday morning is gonna be conference time it ends at noon and there will be the closing Keynote or whatever, and then the afternoon will be the hackathon
hack quick, you hackers!

Don Sizemore said:

Philipp Conzett hotel conference blocks are posted farther up in this thread, and I'm happy to answer any questions.

Thanks, @Don Sizemore !

Don Sizemore said:

Sherry Lake Friday was originally to be a hackathon, before the conference got shifted due to the MexTour game. I think Friday may be "conference time" now but the schedule isn't finalized.

I'd also be happy to do (more) hacking on a Saturday!
Hi! Is there any info on when the registration for DCM will open?

@Balázs Pataki hello! the hold-up has been the payment subsystem. our finance department and the company powering the conference site are ironing out some final bugs, then we should be able to go live Real Soon Now. I'll definitely announce it here.
@Don Sizemore perhaps share the expected costs so folks can budget? Thanks

From a previous question with expected costs from @Don Sizemore (and Heath from UNC):

Don Sizemore said:

Deirdre Kirmis Heath says I can share these: $450 in person ($25 for reception/open bar, $75 for social dinner); $275 virtual; I think it's $50 discount for GDCC members

I was specifically asking about the online registration (in addition to the costs) because, in order to organize my travel, I need to send a link to a registration page or something similar to our travel department. Perhaps others are in the same situation. Routing for "Real Soon Now" :smile:
@Balázs Pataki here's the page with with existing links just not registration. https://dcm2025.hsites.harvard.edu/
Right, linked from https://dataverse.org/events
Yes, thanks, @Sherry Lake, I've seen this.
@Slava Tykhonov (and others): I understand that we're now allowing remote presentations for DCM2025.
@Philip Durbin ☀️ I'll let you be the one to tell Gustavo: the Dataverse Cup got bumped to 0700.
@Gustavo Durand ^^

Another note to the community: the conference space proper can hold 500; the reception space can only hold I believe 150, so once the conference site goes live, receptionistas should register promptly.
Thanks Don! Next time we need DCM2026 in Paris, London or Amsterdam! :)
Will there be an announcement at the end about where the next meeting will be? :drum:
I'd like to go to some place in Italy please. :sweat_smile:
Budapest, maybe? :-)
Long time since I was there last as a kid.
I vote for Barcelona. Will ping Merce about this.

don't look now, but I've tentatively booked Rougarou for Drunk Dataverse on Wednesday, June 11th.
working title: "Dataverse Rebels Unleashing Notable Knowledge?" (a continuation of Phil's "crazy ideas" sessions)
The conference website is now live! Please find the link here

Thanks, @Don Sizemore! Will there be info about accommodations as well? So far I could only see a question regarding "* Accommodation Needed / Food Allergies" as an additional info in the Personal Information section.

@Balázs Pataki there are hotel blocks here https://web.cvent.com/event/497af056-3d1e-4268-a7b7-02d3e2ba04a2/websitePage:0e3a3d38-610e-4f4e-9348-8c766c92223b though I understand the AC is already booked at the conference rate
Oh, great, thank you!
@Balázs Pataki the Graduate is closer but be careful at night. Hampton Inn is a little farther away but surrounded by great bars and restaurants.
@Don Sizemore So there is no discount on registration for GDCC members? An earlier message said $50 off?
@Sherry Lake there is - the payment page offers an entry field. Consortium members should contact jonathan_crabtree@unc.edu for the discount code.
Can we change our selections for the presentation tracks after registration, if needed? Asking for a friend. :blush:

@Deirdre Kirmis I just tried to modify my own schedule, and it told me To request a modification, please reach out to the planner. — we're really asking for these selections for a general headcount in case we need to swap rooms to better align attendance with capacity. The conference dinner and reception spaces have a more restricted capacity; otherwise I told Heath to expect folks to wander around between sessions as their interest changes.
I didn't select anything except my own tracks with my contributions. I don't have any idea yet which other sessions I want to attend...
@Oliver Bertuch :no soup for you gif:

@Don Sizemore okay thanks, that makes sense .. it is more of a "in case we change our mind" .. there are so many good sessions :big_smile: .. and rachel and i wanted to make sure we cover as many as we can

@Deirdre Kirmis We have one huge room that can (mostly) split in half, and three smaller rooms that aren't huge. Particularly the workshops / working groups on Tuesday are in RDMC's building rather than the conference site; those rooms are much smaller. It's all about headcount.
Okay thanks .. I think I'm good with my selections! Excited to see everyone and participate! :tada:
A note from Heath that we're still accepting poster submissions for the community meeting. The poster session will be entirely virtual so there is no need to print them or carry them on a plane.
Virtual? So on a website. Not put on screens.
@Philip Durbin ☀️ I asked for clarification - she meant on screens local to the room, but they could and should go on the website as well.
Ok, thanks, sounds great!
What's the deadline for posters?
day of, quite possibly. easy to accept more until the last minute.
nice
OK, so what is the "Dataverse Cup" about? :smile:

@Balázs Pataki an evening fútbol game played between so inclined conference attendees. I know @Philip Durbin ☀️ has photo galleries somewhere, but I did find this from 2019: https://projects.iq.harvard.edu/dcm2019/dataverse-cup
I'll cheer y'all on from the sidelines.
Ha, yes, @Dwayne Liburd has definitely taken a lot of pics of the Dataverse Cup over the years.
@Gustavo Durand has organized it in the past
beware this year it got bumped to 0730 EDT (sorry)
Great, I bring my fútbol shoes, then! :-)
Another issue: the Opening Reception (includes open bar) and Social Dinner are not available anymore in the registration form. Are these all full or am I just missing something?
It wasn't available to me, either, and I registered yesterday
I tried to register about an hour ago and both were presented as options - I didn't select them (or complete registration yet) since I could not find them on the agenda.

You all be careful with those shoes because some of us will be playing
without them;) Friendly game and all playing levels :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
@Courtney Mumma Heath said those got fixed today - let me know if you'd like to add them? @Frank Smutniak I'll verify but I think the reception is Tuesday, the dinner Thursday.
oh i already registered .. can i add them? and I think probably @Rachel Fernandez might want to
Hey @Don Sizemore I'd like to add both, yes.
Just FYI, looks like the conference rate for the AC Chapel Hill ends on the June 13th. Is there any way that it can be extended until the 14th for those that are wanting to stay for the Hackathon?
@Don Sizemore I was able to register for the social events now, thanks for the fix! I'm not sure how I can get/access the invoice online, though. Or will it be given at the conference?

Hi all,

I've temporarily opened up conference registrations to allow people who registered during the period when the social dinner/reception weren't showing up to go in and add those things to their registration.

I've also added a link to download invoices and/or receipts to the "registration confirmation/ modification confirmation" emails. That should allow everyone who adds the social events to download their invoices, and should also allow those of you who needed receipts to file for reimbursement to download those. I've re-sent those confirmation emails to everyone who's already registered so you'll have that link.

Hope this helps!

Heath
Perfect, thanks @Heath Sledge ! Can confirm, I could register for the social events now. :blush:

@Rachel Fernandez The AC hotel manager ( Monnoca.Badonnih@marriott.com ) says no on extending, but there is a "UNC Visitor" rate:

"We are not able to extend the same discount to Friday night, our rates on Friday and Saturday nights are typically higher than weekdays and any discounts would be allocated appropriately at the time of booking. As an alternative option, we can extend a UNC visitor discount on that day to any existing reservations, they can email me directly with their confirmation number and I can manually add the one night - the current UNC visitor is $237 per night on Fri and Sat, discounted from $279 - please note our rates can change as often as weekly depending on availability so these rates are not guaranteed."
@Don Sizemore thank you for the update and for looking into it! Any discount helps :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:

HEY FOLKS, If you require an invitation letter for the meeting, please reach out to @Don Sizemore Don, I have shared a templated letter with Jon, Heath, and Thu Mai.

Cheers

Sonia Barbosa said:

HEY FOLKS, If you require an invitation letter for the meeting, please reach out to Don Sizemore Don, I have shared a templated letter with Jon, Heath, and Thu Mai.

Cheers

Actually, you all can reach out directly to me at heathl@unc.edu. Just let me know your name, address, affiliation, title, and who to address the letter to. Thanks!

From Jon Crabtree:

The program committee for this year’s Dataverse Community Meeting is looking for YOU!

We are seeking volunteers to introduce speakers and to serve as moderators.

Please email jonathan_crabtree@unc.edu if you would like to volunteer. If you have a specific session you are interested in let me know and I will calculate that into my plan.

Non-Volunteers be prepared to be VolunTASED when needed 😉

Time to get excited for a great time together!
Hi all! Could all presenters please send in headshots and brief bios ASAP, so we can get them up on the website? Right now 2/3 of y'all are showing up as blank profile pictures. :)
Will there be a video showcase for repository updates this year?
yes, Sonia and Luna (one of our people) are working on getting it organized now
REMINDER: all presenters need to register for the conference! We are closing in on catering deadlines, etc., so we are trying to get numbers nailed down sooner rather than later.
Is is possible to register for remote presentations only?
You can register for virtual attendance, yes--there's a registration path for that and for in-person attendees.

Hotel courtesy blocks are posted above in this thread. The A/C Hotel in particular increased the block size, so more should be available, but many of the rooms held for blocks will be released on or around May 10th/11th. Make your reservations now!

The countdown timer is fun
countdown.png

Philip Durbin ☀️ said:

The countdown timer is fun
countdown.png

I need one of those for my countdown to retirement - 24 working days!!!

Will miss EVERYONE at the Dataverse 2025 Community Meeting.

from Jon Crabtree:

”We are excited to have everyone come visit us for the 2025 Dataverse Community Meeting here in Chapel Hill NC!

The agenda is shaping up to be a wonderful and informative event. Not to mention FUN!

I wanted to take time to remind everyone to register for the event ASAP!

https://web.cvent.com/event/497af056-3d1e-4268-a7b7-02d3e2ba04a2/summary
The deadline to register is May 30th !

You only have about 2 weeks to register and hold your spot!

Also, I would like to remind all presenters that you must register as well! Many of you have not!

We want to ensure we have enough space and catering for every one in our community.

See you soon!”
@Don Sizemore do virtual presenters need to give you a heads-up, to make sure the room is equipped for it? :smile: I believe my slot is 4:30 PM Thursday (Tools Track)!
@Vaida Plankytė hello, I apologize, I passed your question along to Heath but she has been out for a few days. She is back today and we hope to be in touch.

Vaida Plankytė said:

Don Sizemore do virtual presenters need to give you a heads-up, to make sure the room is equipped for it? :smile: I believe my slot is 4:30 PM Thursday (Tools Track)!

All the rooms are ready for virtual presentations. We will be able to tell whether you registered for virtual attendance or in-person attendance for the conference, but also, as Mandy mentioned in an email to all accepted presenters, everyone needs to submit their slides to us by a certain date before the conference—people who will be presenting virtually can also remind us of that then.
Fingers crossed that exporting from Google Slides to Powerpoint works well. :smile:

Alumni Hall has weird audio. Hi Vaida! Your session is 45 minutes and there are two presentations during that session, so you and Rory will have about 20 minutes total, I think.

If anyone else is curious about session times, the agenda on the Cvent site is kept up to date, and you can figure out how much time you have by dividing the time slot by the number of presenters!

ANNOUNCEMENT: we did tech tests today in Alumni Hall (if you want to know what room your presentation is in, see the agenda on the conference website).

What we discovered about multimedia in slides wrt remote attendees:

  • you CAN show videos with sound or live demos with sound from the presentation computer, and remote people can hear it
  • you CAN talk and remote people can hear it
  • you CANNOT do both at the same time!

In other words, audio can only be from one input at a time.

So if you want to talk over your website demonstration that has sound, or comment on videos you are playing, the remote people will only be able to hear one or the other audio tracks, not both.
The videos I want to play have audio already so it sounds like I'm all set. Thanks, @Heath Sledge!

The Large Data Working Group will meet on Friday June 13th, onsite and remote Zoom option.

The agenda document is here and you can leave a comment if you have anything you'd like to discuss:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zovekD5iN2GslgwzzAvQ1_M1cOBdr0hl6b3rrgkimwk/edit?tab=t.0

Working group: Large Data at 2025DCM

Friday, June 13⋅2:00 – 4:00pm

Location:

Carolina Square room 6042

Folks, we need more registrants; virtual is the only option available. Please share this with your groups and other connections in other installations. Thanks

Dear Community:
The Dataverse Project Team at IQSS and the UNC team hosting the 2025 Dataverse Community Meeting would like to encourage community members and repositories to register for this year’s virtual attendance option:

https://web.cvent.com/event/497af056-3d1e-4268-a7b7-02d3e2ba04a2/summary

We know that not everyone in our community can travel to attend in person this year, and we truly wish you could. But we don’t want you to miss out.

That’s why the virtual attendance option includes access to workshops on June 10 and all the presentations, panels, and discussions throughout the week.

We encourage every organization, institution, or repository to purchase one virtual group ticket and bring your local community together to participate. Whether it’s a conference room, a cozy office, or a shared space, gather your people and be part of something bigger.

The team has poured heart and soul into creating a meaningful, connected experience. With the reduced cost of virtual attendance, we hope this makes it easier for everyone to join us, even from afar.
We need you there. Let’s make it a week to remember — together.

Regards,

The Dataverse Project
